result.execSummary:
The defendant Kimberly R Turner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(h).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.
Defendant to comply with any further terms or conditions as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent. DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

miscConds.notes: Same repayment conditions as noted in Count 1.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kimberly R Turner

defendant.name: Turner, Kimberly R
defendant.address: W4642 S County Road A, Wild Rose, WI 54984

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Case called @ 2:39 p.m. Defendant Kimberly R Turner in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. Upon motion of the State the Court amends Ct 1 to Possession of an Illegally Obtained Prescription contrary to Wis. Stat. 450.11(7)(h).  Plea: Cts 1 & 2 - NC.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Sentencing argument by DA Blader. Sentencing argument by Atty Szilagyi. Court orders: S/W 2 years probation - Conditions: AODA and follow through, defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician, Any other terms or conditions as deemed appropriate by supervising agent. DNA sample and surcharge, costs w/ 60 DTP or PP. Appeal rights given.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Ben Szilagyi in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Szilagyi requests matter be set for plea/sentencing as resolution has been reached.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 13, 2015 at 02:45 pm.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.  Complete ID process with the Sheriff's Department.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Case Called @ 1:10 PM: Defendant Kimberly R Turner in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel.  Def does not wish counsel today.  Being a single mother, she must maintain her DL status.  She is not employed - stay at home mother.  Def referred to SPD for eligibility process.  Court requests that Def meet with SPD today.  Off Record for Def to speak with SPD.  Back of Record @ 1:43 PM:   Court has now been advised that Def does qualify for services.    Complaint Again Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Preliminary Hearing and Time Limits discussed. Defendant wishes to waive time limits for preliminary hearing. Court questions defendant and accepts waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing.  ADA argues as to Signature Bond w'/conditions.  No objection by SPD as to bond request.   STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Status conference scheduled for June 23, 2015 at 09:25 am.
